Package org.opensextant.geodesy

Class UTM

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.geodesy.UTM
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UTM extends Object implements Serializable

The UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) class contains methods to parse and format between UTM coordinate strings and their geodetic (longitude and latitude) equivalents. A UTM object is defined only in terms of the Ellipsoid data model against which projections are made. The default constructor uses the WGS 84 ellipsoid.

Notes:

Projection: Transverse Mercator (Gauss-Kruger type) in zones 6 deg wide.

Longitude of Origin: Central meridian (CM) of each projection zone (degrees of 3, 9, 15, 21, 27, 33, 39, 45, 51, 57, 63, 69, 75, 81, 87, 93, 99, 105, 111, 117, 123, 129, 135, 141, 147, 153, 159, 165, 171, 177, E and W).

Latitude of Origin: 0 deg (the Equator).

Unit: Meter.

False Northing: 0 meters at the Equator for the Northern Hemisphere; 10,000,000 meters at the Equator for the Southern Hemisphere.

False Easting: 500,000 meters at the Central Meridian (CM) of each zone.

Scale Factor at the Central Meridian: 0.9996.

Latitude Limits of System: From 80 deg S to 84 deg N.

Overlap: On large-scale maps and trig lists, the data for each zone, datum, or ellipsoid overlaps the adjacent zone, datum, or ellipsoid a minimum of 40 kilometers. The UTM grid extends to 80.5 deg S and 84.5 deg N, providing a 30-minute overlap with the UPS grid.

Limits of Projection Zones: The zones are bounded by meridians, the longitudes of which are multiples of 6 deg east and west of the prime meridian.

Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinates define two dimensional, horizontal, positions. The sixty UTM zone numbers designate 6 degree wide longitudinal strips extending from 80 degrees South latitude to 84 degrees North latitude. UTM zone characters are letters which designate 8 degree zones extending north and south from the equator. Beginning at 80 deg south and proceeding northward, twenty bands are lettered C through X, omitting I and O. These bands are all 8 deg wide except for band X which is 12 deg wide (between 72-84 deg N).

There are special UTM zones between 0 degrees and 36 degrees longitude above 72 degrees latitude and a special zone 32 between 56 degrees and 64 degrees north latitude:

UTM Zone 32 has been widened to 9 deg (at the expense of zone 31) between latitudes 56 deg and 64 deg (band V) to accommodate southwest Norway. Thus zone 32 it extends westwards to 3 deg E in the North Sea.

Similarly, between 72 deg and 84 deg (band X), zones 33 and 35 have been widened to 12 deg to accommodate Svalbard. To compensate for these 12 deg wide zones, zones 31 and 37 are widened to 9 deg and zones 32, 34, and 36 are eliminated. Thus the W and E boundaries of zones are 31: 0 - 9 deg E, 33: 9 - 21 deg E, 35: 21 - 33 deg E and 37: 33 - 42 deg E.

  • Constructor Details

    • UTM

      public UTM(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint lonLat)
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid. If WGS 84 is desired, instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. The specified Geodetic2DPoint (lon-lat) point is converted to its UTM equivalent.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      lonLat - Geodetic2DPoint coordinates (lon-lat) to be converted to UTM
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if ellip or lonLat are null

    • UTM

      public UTM(Ellipsoid ellip, Longitude lon, Latitude lat)
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid. If WGS 84 is desired, instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. The specified longitude and latitude values are converted to a UTM equivalent.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      lon - Longitude of point to convert to UTM
      lat - Latitude of point to convert to UTM
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if ellip is null

    • UTM

      public UTM(Ellipsoid ellip, int lonZone, char hemisphere, double easting, double northing)
      This constructor takes an ellipsoid. If WGS 84 is desired, instead use one of the constructors without the ellipsoid parameter, since WGS 84 is the default. Convert UTM parameters to equivalent geodetic (lon-lat) position, compute lat band.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid data model for earth
      lonZone - UTM longitudinal zone (1 to 60)
      hemisphere - character 'N' for Northern or 'S' for Southern hemisphere
      easting - positive meters east of false adjusted central meridian for lonZone
      northing - positive meters north of false adjusted origin (equator for 'N' hemisphere)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if ellip is null
      IllegalArgumentException - input parameter error(s)

    • UTM

      public UTM(Geodetic2DPoint lonLat)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for TransverseMercator). The specified Geodetic2DPoint (lon-lat) point is converted to its UTM equivalent.
      Parameters:
      lonLat - Geodetic2DPoint coordinates (lon-lat) to be converted to UTM
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if lonLat is null

    • UTM

      public UTM(Longitude lon, Latitude lat)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for TransverseMercator). The specified longitude and latitude values are converted to a UTM equivalent.
      Parameters:
      lon - Longitude of point to convert to UTM
      lat - Latitude of point to convert to UTM
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if lat or lon are null

    • UTM

      public UTM(int lonZone, char hemisphere, double easting, double northing, boolean distortionException)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for TransverseMercator). Convert UTM parameters to equivalent geodetic (lon-lat) position, compute lat band, and allows projection distortion warnings to optionally cause an Exception.
      Parameters:
      lonZone - UTM longitudinal zone (1 to 60)
      hemisphere - character 'N' for Northern or 'S' for Southern hemisphere
      easting - positive meters east of false adjusted central meridian for lonZone
      northing - positive meters north of false adjusted origin (equator for 'N' hemisphere)
      distortionException - boolean indicating whether distortion exceptions should be thrown
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - input parameter error(s)

    • UTM

      public UTM(int lonZone, char hemisphere, double easting, double northing)
      This constructor assumes the WGS 84 Ellipsoid (default for TransverseMercator). Convert UTM parameters to equivalent geodetic (lon-lat) position, compute lat band.
      Parameters:
      lonZone - UTM longitudinal zone (1 to 60)
      hemisphere - character 'N' for Northern or 'S' for Southern hemisphere
      easting - positive meters east of false adjusted central meridian for lonZone
      northing - positive meters north of false adjusted origin (equator for 'N' hemisphere)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - input parameter error(s)

  • Method Details

    • getLonZone

      public static int getLonZone(double lonDeg, char latBand)
      This method determines the UTM longitudinal zone number for a given lon (in decimal degrees).
      Parameters:
      lonDeg - degrees of longitude to map to UTM longitudinal zone number
      latBand - UTM latitude band character ('C' to 'X", not including 'I' or 'O')
      Returns:
      int for longitudinal zone number (1 to 60)

    • minLonDegrees

      public static double minLonDegrees(int lonZone, char latBand)
      This method determines the minimum longitude (in degrees) for a given lon zone and lat band.
      Parameters:
      lonZone - UTM Longitudinal Zone (1 to 60)
      latBand - UTM latitude band character ('C' to 'X", not including 'I' or 'O')
      Returns:
      minimum longitude (in degrees) for this UTM cell (lon zone and lat band)

    • getCentralMeridian

      public static Longitude getCentralMeridian(int lonZone, char latBand)
      This accessor method gets the appropriate central meridian for the given UTM lon zone and lat band.
      Parameters:
      lonZone - UTM Longitudinal Zone (1 to 60)
      latBand - UTM latitude band character ('C' to 'X", not including 'I' or 'O')
      Returns:
      Longitude of appropriate central meridian for the given UTM cell (zone and band)

      latBand - UTM latitude band character ('C' to 'X", not including 'I' or 'O')

    • getLatBand

      public static char getLatBand(double latDeg)
      This method determines the UTM latitudinal band char for a given lat (in decimal degrees).
      Parameters:
      latDeg - degrees of latitude to map to UTM latitude band character
      Returns:
      character representing latitude band ('C' to 'X', skipping 'I' and 'O')
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if latitude value is out of valid range

    • minLatDegrees

      public static double minLatDegrees(char latBand)
      This method returns the inclusive minimum latitude (in decimal degrees) for the given UTM latitude band char (extra half degree of allowance not included).
      Parameters:
      latBand - UTM latitude band character ('C' to 'X", not including 'I' or 'O')
      Returns:
      minimum latitude for the given band, in decimal degrees
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - - error if lat band char is out of range

      Returns:
      maximum latitude for the given band, in decimal degrees
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - - error if lat band char is out of range

    • validateZoneAndBand

      public static void validateZoneAndBand(int lonZone, char latBand) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method tests longitudinal zone and latitudinal band to make sure they are consistent together.
      Parameters:
      lonZone - UTM Longitudinal Zone (1 to 60)
      latBand - UTM Latitudinal Band ('C' to 'X', but not 'I' or 'O')
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if Zone and Band combination is invalid
